text: <@U0KPFAZNF> I'm running the latest version of chaintool (chaintool version: v0.10.1-SNAPSHOT), built myself, and the hyperledger/fabric-peer docker image which seems to be ~3mo old
<@U25ATRAMB> by "the .. docker image" I assume you mean the v0.6.1-preview release on dockerhub?
is there a newer or better one to use?
ok, part of the story is likely that v0.6.1 requires chaintool v0.9.1
(once we hit v1.0 I plan to do a better job of ABI compatibility)
do you recommend upgrading my fabric, or downgrading my chaintool?
and is there a mainline docker image?
right now, if you are trying to develop on top of fabric, I would advise v0.6 fabric and 0.9.1 chaintool
if you are trying to develop fabric itself, then master and v0.10.0
(though note that chaintool has not yet been qualified on master, I am working on that this week
